content.description:
Thin slabbing originally done with one bolt.  

  Climb the blank appearing slab starting 20 ft left of The Meadows. Finish on Skywalker.
content.protection: 4 bolts and gear to one inch

content.description: This is the classic moderate crack line at Wilton.  Starts left of The Meadows first pitch and right of 5.9 Crack.  Arches into the same cedar tree for the anchor.
content.protection: Natural gear, one old fixed pin, and a cedar tree & bolt for the anchor.

content.description: Fantastic arete route. Originally lead with one bolt. Retro bolted once in the 80's and again in 2015.
content.location: Arete on the far right side of the meadows

content.description:
(P1) Take the crack line up the right side of the large dihedral on the northern end of the Meadows area.  Finish on a large ledge with two bolts.  (P2) Roped or unroped, walk across the grassy ledge (maybe there are bolts here I don't remember) and stop at a cedar tree that are the anchors to 5.9 Crack and Rainy Day People.  (P3) Ascend the wide crack/chimney through some poor quality rock to the very top of the bluff.  Anchor off a tree to rap down to the cedar tree or pull off a miraculous walk-off somewhere.  

  Alt (P1) - Climb 5.9 Crack or Rainy Day People into the start of (P3).
content.protection: All natural gear with anchor building materials.  Bring extra bail slings for the top or just wrap the rope around a tree.

content.description: 5 bolts to anchor.  A low crux at the second bolt leads to easier climbing above.  After the crux, a couple moves through a loose seam lead to a finish on solid Burlington. Trend right around the bulge at the last bolt to reach the anchor.
content.location: Approximately 20 feet left of the Meadows approach gully and 30 feet left of Twin Sons/Ebbers Maul,   Route is flanked on the left by two aging bolts of unknown origin.

climbs.name: Ebber's Maul (Twin sons of different mothers)

content.description: This route is identified by the older style hangers and exposed bolt studs between current clips. Angles slightly up and left with a couple slight runouts to anchor.
content.location: Far left side of Meadows Wall area, right of the easy crack next to the decent gully.

content.description: This is the crackline left of the Rainy Day People, start on the scary looking flake (pull down) climb up to the small tree, head to the anchor tree of the 5.8 crack below the final pitch of The Meadows. Not very much pro past the small tree, but the climbing is easy.
content.protection: Small cams, 1 bolt.  Anchor has cedar tree and one bolt.

content.description: Small crack that caps the left side of the Meadows area.
Shady in the summer before the sun comes over the bluff.  Great area with a two pitch (or three if you rope up for the walking traverse) climb with several options for crack climbs.
